page.title: 05IN PRAISE OF BALQUHIDDER
page.content:
O the Braes of Balquhidder With the hills and the heather Where the foxes and roe deer do roam Loch Voil and Loch Doine where the white horses go This is the land that's my home.
Come home with me to the Braes of Balquhidder To see the Balvaig River flow It twists and it turns and meanders so slow We'll catch a nice trout as we go.
You've heard of Rob Roy and Robert the Bruce Both wonderful swordsmen were they I'll show you Rob's grave and brave Bruce's cave Their hideouts you'll see to this day. Balquhidder my hearts in Balqu'der so special, so peaceful, so free. chorus
